intro: Gomphrena atrorubra, commonly known as the black-red globemallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, spiky inflorescences that range in color from deep red to black, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Gomphrena atrorubra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
